Sunday, May 26, 1935.
Dear
Babs:
I am on the way
from Chungking
to Hankow
after a most strenuous
party in Szechuen
which it was
quite impossible
to write and
if I had written the letter
just have waited to
come along with us
on this plene.
You will
that we arrived in Chungking last
Monday and that I did not know what we
would do after
got there,
However we learned
that Chiang Kai-shek was planning to leave Yunnan-fu
right away
for Kweiyang and
would arrive Chungking on Thursday so we
stayed in Chungking for
an appointment there on Friday.
Jones and
Chevalier went over to Chengtu.
at Chungking•

booked solid for
breakfast,
Forbes and I remained
tiffin and dinner with
meetings in between.

that Remer

both good sports in every way
and I thanked
sincerely and whole heartedly as I

Generalissimo"
is average height and as"Time" describes
him in their usual flippant manner, wasp-waisted.
He is 48 years old but
like most other Chinese
ten years younger.
Madam Chiang is about
typically Chinese.
Beautiful figure, very feminine with lots of
personal charm yet obviously forceful.
She has a beautiful voice and
English of so much better quality than our own that you firak
feel slightly embarrassed at your
own awkardness with your own language.
Her foice and
manner is so much like Anne Lindbergh that I couldn't help
remarking on the resemblance.
She seemed pleased
and spoke of how much
she was attrated by the Lindberghs when
they visited Nanking in 1931.
She was dressed quite simply but wore a jade ring that was probably worth
also jade
